description: From Middle English pedlere, pedlare, pedeler, alteration of Middle English peddere (“hawker, peddler”), of uncertain origin. Compare Medieval Latin pedārius, from Latin pedāre (“to furnish with feet; prop up”).

entries.meaning: An itinerant seller of small goods.
examples: Synonyms: hawker, (obsolete) chapman, huckster, monger, colporteur, solicitor

entries.meaning: (figurative) A fake-news disseminator; A conspiracy-theory propagator.
